verses.text: These were the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: Amnon was the firstborn, by Ahinoam the Jezreelitess; Daniel was the second, by Abigail the Carmelitess;
verses.comment: Daniel is called 'Chileab' in 2 Samuel 3:3; 'Daniel' is the alternate name listed here.

verses.text: Absalom the third, the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur; Adonijah the fourth, the son of Haggith;
Shephatiah the fifth, by Abital; Ithream the sixth, by his wife Eglah.
verses.comment: The children were born during David's time in Hebron.

verses.text: Six were born to him in Hebron, and he reigned there seven years and six months. He reigned thirty-three years in Jerusalem.
verses.comment: David's total reign was forty years; split between Hebron and Jerusalem.

verses.text: These were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, Shobab, Nathan, and Solomon—four—by Bath-shua the daughter of Ammiel.
verses.comment: Bath-shua is another name for Bathsheba. 'Shimea' is 'Shammua' in 2 Sam. 5:14.

verses.text: And there were Ibhar, Elishama, Eliphelet,
verses.comment: Continuing list of sons born in Jerusalem.

verses.text: Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,
Elishama, Eliada, and Eliphelet—nine in all.
verses.comment: The text appears to repeat some names. The presence of two Elishamas and two Eliphelets reflects possible different children with the same name or textual variants.

verses.text: All these were sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines; and Tamar was their sister.
verses.comment: Tamar was David's daughter; other sons from concubines are not named here.

verses.text: Solomon’s son was Rehoboam; Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,
verses.comment: Begins the royal line of Judah.

verses.text: Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,
Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,
verses.comment: Azariah is also known as Uzziah (see 2 Kgs. 15:1).

verses.text: Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,
Amon his son, Josiah his son.
The sons of Josiah: Johanan the firstborn, Jehoiakim the second, Zedekiah the third, Shallum the fourth.
verses.comment: Shallum is another name for Jehoahaz.

verses.text: The sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son.
verses.comment: Jeconiah is also known as Jehoiachin. Zedekiah, a different one from Josiah’s son.

verses.text: The sons of Jeconiah, the captive: Shealtiel his son,
And Malchiram, Pedaiah, Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.
The sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel and Shimei. The sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam and Hananiah, and Shelomith was their sister;
verses.comment: Zerubbabel is significant as the governor who led the return from exile.

verses.text: and Hashubah, Ohel, Berechiah, Hasadiah, and Jushab-hesed—five sons in all.
The sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah and Jeshaiah. The sons of Rephaiah, Arnan, Obadiah, and Shecaniah.
verses.comment: The line continues several generations after the exile.

verses.text: The son of Shecaniah: Shemaiah. And the sons of Shemaiah: Hattush, Igal, Bariah, Neariah, and Shaphat—six in all.
verses.comment: 'Six in all' includes Shemaiah himself (potential minor translation variant; some manuscripts read 'five').

verses.text: The sons of Neariah: Elioenai, Hezekiah, and Azrikam—three in all.
The sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, Eliashib, Pelaiah, Akkub, Johanan, Delaiah, and Anani—seven in all.
verses.comment: This traces the royal line several generations past the return from exile.
